meanings.definition: To play truant or skip school without permission.
meanings.sent1: Tom decided to play hookey and go fishing instead of going to school.
meanings.sent2: It is not good to play hookey from school because education is important.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy thought it would be fun to play hookey and explore the woods.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to play hookey from school led to a day of adventure and discovery.
meanings.sent5: Playing hookey may seem exciting, but it is essential to attend school regularly.

meanings.definition: A small piece of metal or plastic used to fasten garments.
meanings.sent1: She sewed a hookey onto the dress to keep it securely fastened.
meanings.sent2: The jacket's zipper broke, so she used a hookey to close it.
meanings.sent3: The tailor added an extra hookey to the pants to ensure a perfect fit.
meanings.sent4: The hookey on the necklace clasp gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: Make sure the hookey on your bracelet is closed tightly to avoid losing it.
